name: The Ashbrooke

reviews.text: My mother and I had a girls weekend away in Door County and chose to stay here because of the Adults Only policy. It proved to be an excellent choice. The bathroom was spotless. I took a bath in the practically sparkling white tub which was nicely-sized. It was quiet at all times of day, although we didn't spend any time in our room during the afternoon hours. The room was spacious and we took advantage of the free DVD rental on a chilly evening that we wanted to spend indoors. Climate control in the room works wonderfully, so the temperature was always set to our liking. The only drawback to the Ashbrooke is that it is not on the waterfront. I recommend this location to anyone who is traveling without children.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised by the spotless room on the 2nd floor. The adults only property was very quiet and enjoyable to us, hardly felt that there were other people there. Loved the pool and hot tube, we had it to ourselves on both nights, the little gym was sufficient for me. There were muffins and good coffee along with a nice fireplace in the reception area, unfortunately you had to walk out of our building to get there and it did not have a table and chairs to comfortably enjoy our coffee and the fireplace. Other than being a little on the expensive side, it was a pleasant stay during the height the autumn color show. PERFECT TIMING.
reviews.title: Pleasant but $$$

reviews.text: Stayed here the same weekend last year. Quiet / no kids. Enjoyed our stay again. Staff very nice. Pool, fitness center, sauna and hot tub perfect. Stayed in the same grand whirlpool suite. No issues which is what we expect when we come here.
reviews.title: Always perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spotless and amenities of the property were great. We had a 2nd level Brighton room which was very big and well maintained. We had two issues during our stay. The refrigerator did not work but Ice was available and plentiful. The 32" LCD TV was mounted on the wall and you could clearly hear the neighbors TV. Several times during our stay, the neighbor would turn up his TV in response to our TV being on. I guess that an armoire would buffer the sound some but not with a wall mount. Most of the Brighton rooms face the highway and the noise from the traffic does not calm down until around 7pm in the fall. The hot tub was very large and hot. The pool was great for lap swimming. The hotel does provide an enclosed area for your bicycles with a rack to lock them up. Wifi in the room was excellent. The hotel offers a free USA Today paper daily near the front desk. The grounds are immaculate.
reviews.title: Great value for a high end property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Third trip to D.C. If you want peace and quiet, in a tranquil setting..this place will not let you down.
reviews.title: Nice quiet getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a delightful weekend here midway through a trip around Lake Michigan. Our room on the second floor was quite spacious, comfortably furnished, and very clean. The hotel's location was perfect for us, a short walk from the main dinner options in Egg Harbor and an easy drive to reach Fish Creek and other Door County attractions in the mid- and upper-peninsula. We enjoyed coffee and muffins outside in the morning; great way to start a vacation day. But if you're looking for something more substantial for breakfast, there's a cafe about 100 yards down the road (we didn't go so I can't comment other than to say the parking lot was full on Sunday morning when we left). Best of all--a pool, whirlpool, and deck with no shrieking kids, great for a relaxing break.
reviews.title: Peaceful getaway
Tranquil and peaceful
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Ashbrooke. We stayed in a Grand Suite on the second floor. The rooms were spacious, very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. They provide free wifi, in-room coffee maker, and coffee and muffins in the lobby each morning. I have seen reviewers complaining about the muffins - it's not a "breakfast" folks, it's a muffin and coffee. For us, who are not big breakfast eaters, it was a perfect start to the morning and enabled us to avoid a stop to pick something up before getting our day started.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is that it is Adults Only. It was very peaceful and quiet. The next best thing was the cleanliness and timely maid service. No coming back to an uncleaned room here.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, No Frills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are no in-room safes, which I typically use if they are available, so that would be a suggestion for improvement to the owners. It would also be nice to have a throw available in the living room, since it's a nice place to cozy up.
reviews.title: Bill&Beck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on the outskirts of town, about a 10 minute walk to restaurants and shops. This didn't bother us because we liked getting the exercise and it added to the tranquility of the place.
reviews.title: Quality and no kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the first time visitor to Door County this is not the ideal hotel. It is very clean and the rooms are spacious. The decor is very outdated. The service was average with very spotty Intenet access and an inability to obtain needed services when an item wasn't working in the room. The morning breakfast included only muffins without healthy choices such as fruit. The location is the largest disadvantage with the requirement to drive to all activities. The traffic outside was noticeable from the room as well. This hotel was not worth the price that was paid.
reviews.title: First Trip to Door County

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: service was very good. the rooms were quite comfortable, well kept, reasonably spacious, and very clean. the A/C worked very well. they have Wi-Fi in the rooms.
reviews.title: have stayed here twice, would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the ground were nice.
reviews.title: Excellent couples getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location is not great--not that near things, not on the water.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: they include a nice complimentary breakfast of donuts w/coffee and tea.
reviews.title: Charming & Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Ashbrooke. We chose it in part due to its "adults only" policy, and frankly liked being in a place without a lot of kids running around. It was a quiet, sedate place; if that's not what you want, don't go there.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and nicely kept, although we agree with the comments that the decor was a bit dated. Room had a fridge and microwave, which was nice. Good bed and bedding.
reviews.title: "10 Years and Counting"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the Ashbrooke ~ my husband and I have stayed here every year since 2004. We come to Door County for a mini vacation from our two children ~ we love the "adults only" policy! Check-in is a breeze, the rooms are great (king size beds are so comfortable!), they have a place for our bikes - so we can lock them up, the free DVD rental is perfect for watching the movies we don't have time to watch at home, the light breakfast is just right since we are usually on the go. We use the hot tub and indoor pool and really enjoy the sun deck. In room fridge, microwave and coffee maker are a plus. We would highly recommend the Ashbrooke if you are looking for a clean, quiet place to stay in Door County! Looking forward to coming back in June 2014!
reviews.title: Adults only? should be labeled 55+ hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside of this hotel is very nice and clean but once you get into your room it is EXTREMELY outdated and smells. The décor is old, like something my grandma would use. I picked this hotel because it said ADULTS ONLY but it really should be labeled senor citizen hotel. I think me and my husband were the youngest ones there.
reviews.title: 90s Shelter, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also picked this hotel because it had whirlpools in the room, they stated double person whirl pools. This was highly misleading - they were very small. I was very disappointed.
reviews.title: Top Shelf

description: Welcome to The Ashbrooke where elegance and romance abound. Our renowned attention to detail and unyielding commitment to excellence prove everyday that quality, comfort and courteous hospitality still count. Your escape to The Ashbrooke will renew your faith in customer service, and your stay will be an unforgettable experience. Your search for a great getaway stops here at The Ashbrooke, located on the beautiful Door County peninsula, the best Wisconsin has to offer.
